name: LIST (DOS only)
description: This command will list a file, or a group of array fields, to the screen, printer, or a disk file.
syntax:
LIST field_list TTL title_list MEM NUM number CNTR counter_field
FILE filename/@file_number KEY keyname/@key_number
START start_value SCOPE scope scope_value FOR for_filter_expression
WHILE while_filter_expression PTO print_to PFN print_to_file NOFF

parameters.name: field_list
parameters.description: Same as LIST: This is the list of fields to be used in this command.

parameters.name: title_list
parameters.description: Same as LIST: Optional - This list will be displayed after any automatic top of form and as the first line printed by the command.

parameters.name: MEM
parameters.description: Optional - If you are listing from an array in memory instead of a standard file include this option in the command.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: If MEM is set, then this is Required - If MEM is specified then this the number of elements in the array to be listed.

parameters.name: CNTR
parameters.description: Optional - This is an I type field that will be used for passing the number of records read, and the current array number, to your program.

parameters.name: counter_field
parameters.description: Optional - This is an I type field that will be used for passing the number of records read, and the current array number, to your program.

parameters.name: FILE
parameters.description: Optional - The name or number of the file to be used.

parameters.name: filename/@file_number
parameters.description: Optional - The name or number of the file to be used.

parameters.name: KEY
parameters.description: Optional - Set this to the appropriate value to list the records in the file in the correct order.

parameters.name: keyname/@key_number
parameters.description: Optional - Set this to the appropriate value to list the records in the file in the correct order.

parameters.name: START
parameters.description: Optional - The value to use as the beginning record.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Optional - This option may help determine how many records are listed.

parameters.name: scope_value
parameters.description: Optional - If scope is set to N or F this is the number of records to listed.

parameters.name: for_filter_expression
parameters.description: Optional - You would use this option to restrict the records listed in this command.

parameters.name: while_filter_expression
parameters.description: Optional - This option also restricts the records listed.

parameters.name: PTO
parameters.description: Optional - Use this option to direct the output of this command.
